title: 1. Mountain Pose (Tadasana)
description: Mountain Pose is the foundation of all standing poses. It improves posture, strengthens the legs, and helps with focus.
instructions: Stand straight with feet together or slightly apart.
Distribute weight evenly across both feet.
Engage your knees, draw in your thighs, and contract your glutes.
Lower your shoulders, let your arms hang naturally with palms facing thighs.
Lengthen your neck, gaze forward.
Breathe calmly for 30–60 seconds.

title: 2. Mindfulness Meditation
description: A practice of being present in the moment without judging thoughts or feelings. Ideal for reducing anxiety.
instructions: Sit comfortably on a chair, cushion, or bench.
Keep your back straight but not tense.
Close your eyes or lower your gaze.
Focus on your breath: inhale and exhale.
When thoughts distract you, gently return to your breath.
Practice for 5–10 minutes daily.

title: 3. Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana)
description: One of the most common poses, it stretches the entire body, particularly the back, legs, and shoulders.
instructions: Start in a tabletop position on all fours.
Place your hands slightly ahead of your shoulders, fingers spread wide.
Lift your hips up, straightening your legs (knees can be slightly bent).
Form an inverted triangle with your body from shoulders to heels.
Keep your head between your arms, neck relaxed.
Breathe deeply for 30–60 seconds.

title: 4. Pranayama Breathing: Nadi Shodhana
description: Alternate nostril breathing calms the mind and balances energy flows.
benefits: Balances left and right brain hemispheres
instructions: Sit upright with a straight spine.
Using your right hand, form a 'mudra gesture': thumb and ring finger free.
Close your right nostril with your thumb.
Inhale slowly through your left nostril.
Close your left nostril with your ring finger, open your right, and exhale.
Inhale through the right, close it, exhale through the left—this is one cycle.
Repeat for 5–10 cycles.

title: 5. Child’s Pose (Balasana)
description: A relaxing pose for rest and recovery, excellent for relieving back tension.
instructions: Kneel with your hips resting on your heels.
Lean forward, placing your chest between your thighs.
Extend your arms forward or rest them alongside your body, palms up.
Rest your forehead on the floor.
Breathe calmly for 1–3 minutes.

title: 6. Body Scan Meditation
description: A meditation practice where you sequentially focus on each part of the body, from toes to head.
instructions: Lie on your back with arms at your sides, palms up.
Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths.
Focus on the tips of your toes, feeling them.
Slowly move upward: feet, ankles, calves, knees, thighs...
Continue to the crown of your head.
Stay in this state for 5–10 minutes.
Slowly return to awareness.

title: 7. Warrior II Pose (Virabhadrasana II)
description: A classic power pose that builds endurance and concentration.
instructions: Stand straight, take a wide step back.
Bend your front knee to a 90-degree angle, keep the back leg straight.
Extend your arms parallel to the floor.
Gaze forward.
Hold the pose for 30–60 seconds on each side.

title: 8. Tree Pose (Vrksasana)
description: A balancing pose that develops stability and focus.
instructions: Stand straight with feet together.
Place the sole of your right foot on the inner thigh of your left leg.
Press your palms together at chest level or raise your arms overhead.
Maintain balance and steady breathing.
Hold for 30–60 seconds, then switch legs.

title: 9. Corpse Pose (Savasana)
description: A final relaxation pose to restore energy.
instructions: Lie on your back with arms and legs relaxed.
Close your eyes.
Focus on your breath.
Fully release tension.
Remain for 5–10 minutes.

title: 10. Cobra Pose (Bhujangasana)
description: A gentle backbend that strengthens the spine and opens the chest.
instructions: Lie face down with palms under your shoulders.
On an inhale, lift your chest, straightening your arms.
Draw your shoulders back and down.
Keep your hips and legs pressed into the floor.
Breathe calmly for 15–30 seconds.

title: 11. Triangle Pose (Trikonasana)
description: A standing pose that stretches the sides of the body and strengthens the core.
instructions: Stand with feet wide apart, about 3–4 feet.
Turn your right foot out 90 degrees, left foot slightly in.
Extend your arms parallel to the floor.
Reach your right hand toward your right foot, resting it on your shin or the floor.
Extend your left arm upward, gaze toward your left hand.
Hold for 30–60 seconds, then switch sides.

title: 12. Seated Forward Bend (Paschimottanasana)
description: A seated pose that stretches the back and hamstrings, promoting relaxation.
instructions: Sit with legs extended straight in front of you.
Inhale, lengthen your spine, and raise your arms.
Exhale, hinge at your hips, and reach for your feet or shins.
Keep your spine long, avoid rounding your back.
Hold for 1–3 minutes, breathing deeply.

title: 13. Loving-Kindness Meditation (Metta)
description: A meditation practice to cultivate compassion and love for oneself and others.
instructions: Sit comfortably with a straight spine.
Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths.
Repeat phrases like 'May I be happy, may I be healthy.'
Extend these wishes to loved ones, acquaintances, and all beings.
Practice for 10–15 minutes, focusing on feelings of warmth.

title: 14. Bridge Pose (Setu Bandhasana)
description: A gentle backbend that strengthens the glutes and opens the chest.
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet hip-width apart.
Place your arms alongside your body, palms down.
Inhale, lift your hips toward the ceiling.
Press into your feet, keep your knees aligned.
Hold for 30–60 seconds, then lower slowly.

title: 15. Cat-Cow Pose (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana)
description: A gentle flow between two poses to warm up the spine and improve flexibility.
instructions: Start on all fours, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Inhale, arch your back, lifting your chest and tailbone (Cow).
Exhale, round your spine, tucking your chin and tailbone (Cat).
Flow between poses for 5–10 breaths.

title: 16. Breath of Fire (Kapalabhati)
description: A dynamic breathing technique to energize the body and clear the mind.
instructions: Sit upright with a straight spine.
Take a few deep breaths to prepare.
Exhale sharply through your nose, contracting your abdomen.
Let inhalations happen passively between exhales.
Perform for 30 seconds, then rest and repeat 2–3 times.

title: 17. Warrior I Pose (Virabhadrasana I)
description: A powerful standing pose that builds strength and opens the hips.
instructions: Stand with feet wide apart, turn your right foot out 90 degrees.
Bend your right knee to a 90-degree angle, keep left leg straight.
Raise your arms overhead, palms facing each other.
Square your hips toward the front, gaze forward.
Hold for 30–60 seconds, then switch sides.

title: 18. Gratitude Meditation
description: A meditation practice to cultivate appreciation and positivity.
instructions: Sit or lie down in a comfortable position.
Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths.
Reflect on things you’re grateful for, big or small.
Feel the warmth and positivity of each thought.
Practice for 5–10 minutes.

title: 19. Half Moon Pose (Ardha Chandrasana)
description: A balancing pose that strengthens the legs and core while improving coordination.
instructions: Start in Triangle Pose with your right hand on the floor or a block.
Lift your left leg parallel to the floor, keeping it straight.
Extend your left arm upward, open your chest.
Balance on your right leg and hand, gaze upward or forward.
Hold for 30–60 seconds, then switch sides.

title: 20. Thread the Needle (Parsva Balasana)
description: A gentle twist that releases tension in the upper back and shoulders.
instructions: Start on all fours, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Thread your right arm under your body, resting your shoulder on the floor.
Lower your chest toward the ground, keeping hips high.
Hold for 30–60 seconds, breathing deeply, then switch sides.

title: 21. Lion’s Breath (Simhasana Pranayama)
description: An energizing breathing practice that releases tension and boosts confidence.
instructions: Sit in a comfortable position, such as kneeling or cross-legged.
Inhale deeply through your nose.
Exhale forcefully through your mouth, sticking out your tongue and roaring.
Open your eyes wide and gaze upward.
Repeat 5–10 times, resting between rounds.

title: 22. Reclining Bound Angle Pose (Supta Baddha Konasana)
description: A restorative pose that opens the hips and promotes relaxation.
instructions: Lie on your back, bring the soles of your feet together, knees out to the sides.
Place your arms relaxed by your sides or on your abdomen.
Use props under your knees for support if needed.
Breathe deeply and hold for 3–5 minutes.

title: 23. Walking Meditation
description: A mindful walking practice to connect with the present moment.
instructions: Find a quiet space where you can walk slowly.
Walk at a natural pace, focusing on each step.
Notice the sensation of your feet touching the ground.
Coordinate your breath with your steps if desired.
Practice for 10–15 minutes.

title: 24. Eagle Pose (Garudasana)
description: A balancing pose that improves focus and strengthens the legs.
instructions: Stand straight, bend your knees slightly.
Cross your right thigh over your left, hooking your right foot behind the left calf.
Cross your left arm over your right, bending elbows to hook hands.
Balance and hold for 30–60 seconds, then switch sides.

title: 25. Reclining Twist (Supta Matsyendrasana)
description: A gentle spinal twist that releases tension and promotes relaxation.
instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended to the sides.
Bring your right knee to your chest, then guide it across your body to the left.
Keep your shoulders flat on the ground, gaze to the right.
Hold for 1–2 minutes, then switch sides.
